title: [Desktop][Playlists] Playlist update
author: Tale2
body: Recent updates to Spotify have changed the layout of the playlist model, making it easily accessable to get to your favourite playlists.But the update means it's very difficult to access your older playlists, or less frequently used. The layout before meant you could design your playlists into folders.The search 'tab' is useful, but would fail if you can't recall the name of the playlist.I feel this current update would be better by including that more organised folder system - it's a bit more user friendly; especially for people like me who've created or follow a large number of different styles or genre. 😅
status_message: Updated on 2023-04-10 Hi @Tale2,   We appreciate you bringing your feedback to the Idea Exchange! We'll have to close your submission since it doesn’t meet one of our Idea Exchange guidelines, namely point 5: “Make sure your idea is clear”.   At this point, we don’t have enough information regarding what you'd like to see implemented.   The new design of Your Library is mostly visual - all core features are still available, so you can organize your playlists into folders or sort and filter in Your Library the way you see fit. You can also pin up to 4 items so that they always appear at top of Your Library.       Note that you can also switch to compact view from Settings > Library > Use compact library in case you prefer having just the names of the items in Your Library, without the cover images.   In case you meant something else, feel free submit your idea again, highlighting how it's different from the current experience and including as many details as possible. That way everyone can have a better understanding of what you're suggesting and can show their support.   Take care.

title: [iOS][Discover] Promote listener-created/curated playlists
author: Lazyeye
body: Home feed could promote not just spotify-made playlists, but other user's playlists that might appeal to people who listen to similar music.I personally frequent other listener's playlists to find new music for playlists of my own. People can make their playlists public, and we can find them in search, however, titles are personalized so searching doesn't always deliver what we're looking for. Furthermore, unless we know of certain listener profiles, they'll likely stay undiscovered.A problem with a solution: Although some playlist-makers have public playlists, they're not always wanting to promote their playlists or a playlist is just not ideal for home feed. This could be remedied by either playlist popularity (if it's already a popular public playlist, there's no reason not to offer it to the home feed), or possibly adding an "allow on home feed" button under the "..." button on playlists. I'd prefer the latter simply because I know I have playlists that have been meticulously curated, but because of creative titles & low follower count, nobody else knows about them. But these are playlists I've made simply because I couldn't find anything similar, and I'm sure other people would appreciate being able to share their own "that's exactly what I was looking for!" -type playlists, too.
status_message: Updated on 2023-04-10Hey @Lazyeye,Thanks for bringing your feedback to the Idea Exchange.   We’re closing this idea since it doesn’t meet one of our Idea Exchange guidelines, namely “Checking for existing ideas”.   A similar Live idea has already been suggested here - feel free to add your vote to it!   Cheers!

title: [Android][Playlists] Good mixing between tracks, like on radio
author: BEAT_fmguide
body: Imagine, where there is no ear cutting things, while listening your favourite album or favourite playlist or public playlist It just like music mixing, but smart music mixing, which are pleasant for ears, mind and mood, when previous track is finishing, and next is coming, mixing moment can be more comfortable, in that way, feelings after listening music will be increased much more than track is cut and next suddenly starts, or when one track already finished, but next still not started, It is most actual in the playlists or albums. In that way custom playlist or public playlists will be listened to with the feeling, like you're listening to real live radio. Also using another type of mixing, users can add their own jingles, and that would be like their channels turned into real radio.I Suppose many of users will like this feature, Spotify already have option but it works very poor and it similar to all of the tracks, so thats why it works uncorrectHow to make good track mixing? In short words - need to mark all the tracks in time when mixing moment is the best (start and finishing-mixing moment) (like mp3tag), it depends on fade out ending, or on tact track ending. Can show algorythms. And unfortunately cant load mix i've made)

title: [Desktop][Browse] Not interested button
author: roseamandaj
body: I just have a content suggestion. My homepage is currently filled with suggestions of podcasts and other foolishness that I'm not interested in and unlike say Netflix or Hulu where I can say I'm not interested in this suggestion, I can't. So now it takes me like 10-15 minutes to sift through the noise to actually find a Spotify playlist that I want to listen to. There should be a "Not interested" button so that I can find new music and continue my listening journey instead of a bunch of noise that I don't care about. I don't know if you want to tie this to a premium option to increase sales but I'm premium and it's annoying and I would pay more for options. Just food for thought.

title: Lyrics Verification
author: speleojazzer
body: Attaching the wrong lyrics to a song occasionally occurs and is at best annoying and at worse may expose younger or more sensitive customers to damaging content.I suggest three improvements are actioned :1 : The (automatic) linking of lyrics from external providers where there is not an exact match of all items of information, should be flagged up internally for operators to double check, and2 : On the assumption that even (1) is not fool-proof, there needs to be a clicker very visible on the lyrics page for customers to flag up to Spotify staff for immediate attention where lyrics are possibly or definitely miss-matched.3 : Its taken me a lot of searching (including guidance from Spotify support) to get to this point. Navigating customer support should be easier.
status_message: Updated on 2023-04-09Hey @speleojazzer,   Thanks for bringing your feedback to the Idea Exchange!   We’re closing this idea since it doesn’t meet one of our Idea Exchange guidelines, namely point 3: “One change request per Idea.”   On another note, you can already report if the lyrics are not correct by tapping on the flag on the upper right corner of the lyrics and choosing the right option:       If you think your ideas should be considered as separate, feel free to submit them again highlighting how your ideas are distinct from the existing options.   Cheers!

title: [Mobile][Playlists] Be able to change the order of songs in a actual playlist
author: Sin2169
body: I think it would be awesome to be able to change the order of songs in the playlists. Sometimes I discover songs that fit perfectly with a combo of 4-5 songs or something but they are far appart in the playlist and I always have to queue them and I technically can’t listen between them without having to open my phone and it’s not pleasing. Changing the order of songs would be a game changer because I would just have to put them together and I don’t have to make sure which song is gonna play next. I like to reorder by removing songs from the playlist and putting them back in my favorite order. It’s time consuming and sometimes frustrating. So I feel reordering songs is a feature everyone could benefit from. Thank you 🙂
status_message: Updated on 2023-04-07   Hey @Sin2169,   Thanks for bringing your feedback to the Idea Exchange!   We appreciate your elaborate suggestion, however, we'll be closing this idea, since it's already possible to rearrange the song order for the playlists you've created. You can read more about creating, editing and deleting playlists here.    Additionally, seems like the Community folks have already gathered on a similar feature request and have created an Idea about linking together tracks in a playlist. If you'd like to see that option available, go ahead and check this idea. Make sure you leave your vote to support it, so that it would have a better chance of being considered, as Spotify always strives to improve your experience.   Please note that even if an idea is currently set to “Not Right Now” you can still give it a thumbs up to support it as we revisit those ideas on regular intervals. It might be that their time would be right in the future!    More info on how your feedback reaches Spotify via the Idea Exchange can be found here.   Cheers!

title: [Android][Playlists] Make it easy to find my place in a playlist by jumping to active song
author: lbearm
body: I listen to my playlists in order. A few of my playlists are rather larger (over 1,000 songs). When listening to the list, sometimes I want to see where I am at in the playlist (like seeing that I am on song 450 out of 1,000) and then to see what songs are coming next. I know I can see some things in the queue, but I want to look at it from my playlist. This is cumbersome, but not horrible on the Windows interface as it gives me a # for each song on the playlist so I can search up the song and get a feel for where I need to scroll down to. On the Android phone this is just a big pain as I have to scroll until I find the current song and sometimes I miss it and have to start all over again. When I open a playlist that is actively being played, I think it should automatically jump to the active song.
status_message: Updated on 2023-04-06Hey @lbearm,   Thanks for bringing your feedback to the Idea Exchange.   We’re closing this idea since it doesn’t meet one of our Idea Exchange guidelines, namely point 5: "Make sure your idea is clear."   Jumping to the current song in a playlist is currently possible by tapping on the playlist name in the Now Playing view.   Feel free to submit your idea again, making sure to clarify how it differs from the existing experience.   Thanks for understanding.

title: Free On-Demand Play for Mobile Phones
author: Numbskulll
body: On-Demand Play is free on every format (ie: Desktop, Web Browser, Mobile Tablet) EXCEPT mobile phones. That’s ridiculous. Why would a user have to pay for a subscription (which is hardly fairly priced to begin with) for a feature that everyone else gets for free on every single other format? It’s not fair. It honestly feels like Spotify is trying to scam it’s users. I hope this is resolved eventuality because it’s very limiting and frustrating.

title: [Mobile][Playlists] Auto archive Spotify generated playlists for users
author: Roachforlife
body: Each week, I try to remember to save a copy of my Release Radar, Discover Weekly, New Music Friday, etc to a running playlist since there is no way (that I am aware of) to go back to these. An option to auto add each week before they switch to new content would be great. An even better idea would be an additional option to only add the HEARTED songs to that running tally. As an aside, if there is a way to find the links to old playlists, especially the ones custom curated for me (such as Discover Weekly) somehow I would love to know how to access. Thank you
status_message: Updated on 2023-04-04Hey @Roachforlife,   Thanks for adding your votes to this idea.   We're happy to confirm that this is already possible. You can create a copy of a particular set of songs from your Daily mixes, you just need to select the playlist in your mobile device app, then, on the three-point menu select Add to other playlist > New playlist.   As a workaround, if you're from the desktop app, you can copy all the songs in a playlist (including the Daily mixes) by selecting it, scrolling until the last song, and clicking at it while pressing shift. All songs will be selected and by clicking the right mouse button, you can add them to the new playlist.

The whole Idea of seeing when new videos come out is cryptic and **bleep**ed on desktop. title: [Android][Other] Old Issues that has to be worked on
author: Yazu00
body: I looked through a old post describing an Issue I wanted to draw attention to that 'must' be fixed. That post is from 2017 so it's present for a long time. Straight to the point, The Local Files Player for Spotify can't read the ID3 Tag of mp3 or every other sort of audio file, properly. It doesn't notice changes on the file, it doesn't scan the album covers by the file, i assume it scans it by the album cover. It just doesn't scan the file properly it isn't noticing anything and I have no clue how come the Spotify team never even realised how much of a bad experience the local files player is giving their users, a simple music app player on the playstore can literally detect every change on the file, title, what album it's sorted to and what cover it has. I feel like the local files feature was made but never rly done properly. Make this local files player the way every other simple player works with even extra features like giving the user the ability to change the ID3 Tag informations directly trough the app or making a better ui for the local files too. (Added file shows ss of the spotify player showing the wrong album name)I appreciate reading, and I hope this will get the attention It needs.
status_message: Updated on 2023-04-04  Hey @sebbrugs,   Thanks for bringing your feedback to the Idea Exchange.     We’re closing this idea since it doesn’t meet two of our Idea Exchange guidelines, namely “One change request per Idea" and "Check if there's an existing idea".   We appreciate your elaborate idea, however, when one post includes several feature requests, it becomes hard to keep track of and update them.   Additionally, a similar idea has already been suggested here- feel free to add your vote to it, so that it would have a better chance of being considered, as Spotify always strives to improve your experience.   If you still think your idea should be considered as separate, feel free to submit it again highlighting how your idea is distinct from the existing one.   Cheers!

title: Shuffle White/Blacklist and Linked Shuffle
author: JediJess
body: This idea is two in one.First is the Shuffle Blacklist/Whitelist.Simply, when you shuffle or randomise your song to include your liked songs or any extra songs outside the current playlist, be able to choose some songs you specifically want to see in the randomisation, or songs based on ones you'd like to see (Whitelist).Alternatively, when you do the same, have a list of songs you do not want to see played (blacklist). The other idea is Linked Shuffle. Add the ability to (directionally) link a song to another, so only specific songs can play after a given song, or so that only a specific song can play before your chosen song. (Eg, choosing to link The Other Side and The Final Trees by Tarrytown or any song that flows immediately from one to another). Maybe a song can have a whitelist of songs they can shuffle to after being played.
status_message: Updated on 2023-04-04  Hey @JediJess    Thanks for posting in the Idea Exchange!   We’re closing this idea since it doesn’t meet one of our Idea Exchange guidelines, namely “Checking for existing ideas”.     We appreciate your elaborate idea, however, similar ones have already been suggested in our Community. Feel free to add your vote to to them below, so that they would have a better chance of being considered, as Spotify always strives to improve your experience. 1[.Playlists] Ability to link together Tracks in Playlists 2.[All Platforms] Shuffle algorithm that favours "unpopular" songs  3.[All Platforms] Option to have a true shuffle   Please note that even if an idea is currently set to “Not Right Now” you can still give it a thumbs up to support it as we revisit those ideas on regular intervals. It might be that their time would be right in the future!      If you think your idea should be considered as separate, feel free to submit it again highlighting how your idea is distinct from the existing ones.     Cheers!

title: [Desktop][Browse] How likely is my playlist to be found by name indicator
author: marcel885
body: When you create a new public playlist its hard to be found because its likely that there are a lot of playlists with the same name. So for some playlist creators its nice to have an index which indicates how likely it is to be found
status_message: Updated on 2023-04-04Hey @marcel885,Thanks for bringing your feedback to the Idea Exchange!We’re closing this idea since it isn't really something that can be realistically implemented at the moment.  Search results in Spotify are based on a mix of factors including popularity and date of creation, so it takes newer playlists a bit longer to show up in searches. Usually the more streams and follows one playlists has, the bigger changes it has of showing up in search, but that's not all that's taken into consideration. The results also vary from user to user based on personal listening preferences. The algorithm could also consider the musical taste of a user when showing the search results. Hope this clears things up. Thanks for understanding.

title: [iOS][Developer] Spotify needs better user-company communication
author: Lazyeye
body: There's ideas, chat, help...but no way to directly voice your concerns with the company. There's a general comment area that can be filled with complaints, but those are easily brushed off and disregarded–many people "shouting" over one another with little reason or thought. I've had genuine issues with the new Home feed, besides the functionality and inconveniences, yet they fall to deaf ears. Social media does not fill the checklist for a proper customer service desk. There needs to be a number and/or email that deals directly with customer concerns. Where do I put genuine complaints and concerns? Feedback? I can't imagine that Spotify tested this new homepage elsewhere complaint-free. It's bugging up my app so much, I can't skip songs as fast as I used to and everything takes forever to load. My phone is already old and slow, I don't need excess visuals to make it worse. And Yet where do I go to tell them that this isn't simply an aesthetic issue, but technical? I resort to an Ideas board, and I will certainly be going in as many places as are accessible in order to be heard.
status_message: Updated on 2023-04-04Hi there @Lazyeye,   Thank you for voicing your concerns in the Community!   We want to assure you that all feedback threads on the forum are monitored and feedback is passed on to the developer teams regularly.    You can leave your feedback on the UI changes here.    Regarding the slow performance of the app, we'd recommend you check this Ongoing Issue thread for more information.   Hope this info helps.

title: [Desktop][Search] Podcast search within a playlist
author: CourteousCain
body: Currently, the ability to search for episodes within a Podcast is very limited. On the Android Mobile app, you can search for a keyword in a podcast playlist, but it will not show all results in that playlist (it only goes back a period of time, not since the podcast playlist's creation). On the Windows 10 desktop app, there is no feature at all to search within a Podcast. CTRL+F does not work in the app. On the Website, you can use CTRL+F to search, but it only loads a limited number of episodes at a time, so using that search feature is very clunky. In addition, when the webpage gets reloaded, you have to go back down through all the results and load all the episodes you want to search within again.You can search from the basic "Search" function and search for a Podcast name and the title, but you only see very few Episode results, and you can't see all results for that. It's a very clunky and terrible experience trying to search through podcasts. The search feature for songs is implemented great - why is the experience for podcasts so awful? It seems like this idea has been thrown around a lot, but they seem to get closed with a "This was implemented on blah blah blah..." but it's not functional.
status_message: Updated on 2023-04-04Hello @CourteousCain and thanks for bringing your feedback to the Idea Exchange.   We’ll be closing this idea as it doesn’t follow one or more of the following Idea Exchange requirements:  Unclear ideas. Make sure your suggestion does include enough information for us to understand what you’re requesting.  It will be great if you can clarify if you're requesting that all podcast episodes containing a keyword are shown in the search results, regardless of when they were uploaded.   More information about how the Spotify Idea Exchange works can be found here.

title: [iOS][Podcasts] parent controls for podcasts
author: dannachtrieb
body: I signed up for the premium spotify account to have my family have access to music. Now my kids are watching podcast videos of tiktok and even found **bleep** videos posted by a user. This is unacceptable! Why the heck is spotify now a platform for all kinds of video filth? This is a no-brainer that parents should be able to restrict the use of podcasts on spotify. Please add a parental control to disable podcasts for users on the premium accounts.

title: [Discover] More Spotify Charts
author: jxckandrew
body: As a lover of music and data, Spotify charts for various countries provide valuable information into the music market of a particular location. It also is of great service to those who live in that country and are able to have music charts reflecting the music taste of their country, along with showcasing local artists. However with the expanded geographical available of spotify in recent years this hasn't been reflected in the addition of charts for various countries that have a large enough userbase to justify daily charts. Some of the countries that I feel desperately need charts are: - Bangladesh- Sri Lanka- Cyprus- Algeria- Lebanon- Tunisia- Jordan- Kuwait- Albania- Croatia- Moldova- Serbia- Slovenia- Bosnia and Herzegovina- Ghana- Kenya- Tanzania- Uganda- Armenia- Azerbaijan- Georgia- Botswana- Jamaica- Cambodia- Laos- Nepal- Uzbekistan- Zimbabwe- Angola- Mozambique- Ethiopia- Libya and more, I have also seen many others advocate for charts in their countries on social media and this very website. Please consider showcasing the charts of more countries as soon as possible
status_message: Updated on 2023-04-04 Hello @jxckandrew,Thanks for bringing your feedback to the Idea Exchange!   We’ll be closing this idea as it doesn’t follow one of our Idea Exchange requirements, namely:"One change request per Idea. If you have more than one idea please make a new Idea submission for each."There already are active Live Ideas about some of the listed countries. If you feel strongly about any of the ones that currently don't have an active Idea though, you are welcome to post a new Idea about them! 🙂Note: A separate Idea is required for each country.   More information about how the Spotify Idea Exchange works can be found here.Cheers!

title: Do Not Play Artist
author: benthebearslayer
body: Add the option to hide or "block" an artist and/or the option to auto-skip any song specific artists appear in. Just because an artist is considered a certain genre does not mean that I will ever want to listen to the music they create.
status_message: Updated on 2023-04-04 Hey @benthebearslayer,   Thank you for posting in the Idea Exchange.    We'll be closing this idea, since this is already a feature in Spotify. Currently the option to block an artist from being played can only be enabled on mobile device or tablet (iOS or Android).   If you want to block an Artist - follow the steps below:  Go to an Artist profile on Mobile App > click the 3 dot menu > Don't play this.   Turning on this option will block content from that artist across all devices. Note that if the artist is featured in a song/ album from another artist it might still be playable.   Screenshot for visibility below. Please note that this Artist on the image below is used just to show you how to use the feature.    Cheers!

title: [Android][Other] Clear Queue for Android App
author: Guy23
body: Add a "clear all" button to the play queue for the Android app. Pretty straightforward - I can't believe this needs saying.
status_message: Updated on 2023-04-04 Hey @Guy23,   Thanks for bringing your feedback to the Idea Exchange!   We'll have to close your submission since it doesn’t meet the following Idea Exchange guidelines:   3: "Make sure your idea is clear". 4: “Check if there's an existing idea”.  Note that the queue is split into two sections: Next In Queue (these are the items you've manually queued via the "Add to queue" button and will be prioritized) and Next From (the rest of the currently playing playlist/album/podcast).   The Clear queue button is currently only available for the Next In Queue section, however, a similar request about making it available for Next From as well has already been submitted here, so make sure to check it out and give it a thumbs up to show your support!      In case you meant something else, or you think your idea should be considered as separate, you can always submit it again highlighting how it’s distinct from the existing feature/idea and including as much relevant info as possible.   Take care.

title: [Mobile][Podcasts] Dismiss episodes from "New episodes"
author: JGeazy
body: I would like to use the "New episodes" playlist as a sort of hub, where all episodes from all podcasts that I follow go into one playlist. From there, I either add them to "My episodes" if I want to listen to them directly or to various playlists if I'll listen to them later. However, it is not possible, to take episodes out of the "New episodes", unless you marked them as listened. Otherwise, the "New episodes" playlists becomes quite cluttered.

title: [Mobile][Playlists] Mixtape Style within Playlist
author: _8-gihn43kbu8
body: Are you extremely abnormally specific about your music playlist? Because, unfortunately, I am :(. I've realized that some of my *many* playlists are within the same genre, but I have split them up because of vibes. But sometimes, I don't want that many playlists, but I do want separation. So what if Spotify had a feature like a mixtape that offers you a Side A/ Side B but in one playlist? For instance, let's say you like Classic Rock, like ALOT, but you know each decade has a different sound. You want the ability to listen to them all together but also want to organize them by decade. The playlist would then be " Classic rock" and within it have side or sections so that you could listen to just 60s, 70s, 80s, and so on. Another example is, let's say you're a seasons girlie, and you're in your 2023 ERA. Would it not be cool to have a playlist called 2023 ERA and, within that playlist, have sections for fall, spring, winter, and summer??Let me know what yall think!!

title: [Community][Other] 5 Year Student Discount
author: lady_rainicorn3
body: Spotify currently only offers 4 years of student discount. While I'm sure that this covers a lot of students for the duration of their studies, it does miss out a fair proportion of students. In the UK, there are courses that last 5 years, such as Medicine and Veterinary Medicine, which means for the final year of the course these students can't benefit from student premium despite being a student. I don't think it would be unreasonable to offer a 5th year of premium for these students; it wouldn't apply to everyone and only those who still have access to their university accounts for 5 years so I don't believe Spotify would necessary be at a loss from this. It would benefit those who are still studying and use Spotify but may not be able to pay the full premium cost as they are still paying student fees and are yet to graduate.
status_message: Updated on 2023-04-04Hey @lady_rainicorn3,   Thanks for bringing your feedback to the Idea Exchange.   We’re closing this idea since it doesn’t meet one of our Idea Exchange guidelines, namely point 7: "No pricing, subscription or content related requests."   Feel free to submit your idea again, making sure that it adheres to the above guidelines.   Thanks for understanding.

title: [Playlists] Add to Playlist, Sorted by Closest Genre
author: falconia
body: If you have a lot of playlists, it can be tedious sifting through them to find the one that matches the genre or mood of a song. With Spotify's sophisticated system of linking songs with similar genres and moods, I feel this would be a very minor tweak. What I am suggesting is that when you are choosing to add a particular song to one of your custom playlists, by default, it should predict which playlist best matches that song and sort them by that criteria.
status_message: Updated on 2023-04-04Hello @falconia and thanks for bringing your feedback to the Idea Exchange.   We’ll be closing this idea as it doesn’t follow one or more of the following Idea Exchange requirements:  Unclear ideas. Make sure your suggestion does include enough information for us to understand what you’re requesting.  It's a bit unclear how the app will sort your playlists based on genre, since there is currently no limitation to the amount of songs or types of genres that can be added into a playlist. Furthermore, would this be a setting that can be manually switched on, or will it be default behavior? What happens if you have multiple playlists featuring songs from the same genre, how will they be sorted?   More information about how the Spotify Idea Exchange works can be found here.

title: [Other] Make Spotify more attractive for casual listeners
author: telt
body: For casual listeners the subscription of 10€/month is too expensive. They would only subsidize the ones streaming for hours each day. I only stream on spotify to discover new music or listen to albums I dont already own so it would be great to have a payment plan where you pay on a per-stream basis. If I could preload my account with some amount and then pay e.g. 2ct per stream, it would be much better than listening to ads. And Spotify could win by getting currently non-paying users or users off othermusic providers.
status_message: Updated on 2023-04-03Hey @telt,   Thanks for bringing your feedback to the Idea Exchange!   We’re closing this idea since it doesn’t meet one of our Idea Exchange guidelines, namely point 7: “No pricing, subscription or content related requests.”   Thanks for understanding.

title: Multilingual lyrics
author: Urmi06
body: I listen to a lot of international music like spanish, korean, german, hindi as well as english songs but I am only proficient in English so I can understand the lyrics of English songs only. I am pretty sure there are thousands of users who are comfortable in one or two languages but they do listen to a variety of music. I do understand the need of showing the lyrics in the original language in which the songs are created but everytime I want to understand the meaning of the songs I need to Google it. I do not know if this feature is there in the premium version as I am using the free one but I do think it would be a huge hit if the listeners can switch the lyrics version from the original format(e.g Korean/spanish) to their own comfortable languages( English in my case). Just the thought for the tea. ☕

title: [Desktop] Social Feed Interaction
author: ashklunk
body: This is an idea that has a wide spread, so it's hard to specify one exact action within the app. I want to preface this by saying that the social aspect of Spotify makes it unique and well-loved by myself and all of my friends and family. The ability to interact with each other through shared playlists, and to be able to see what everybody is listening to live in the app is what we love the most. It turns our personal music library and listening habits into something that we can share, which is exactly what music is about. Sharing and connecting. Spotify is the app for real music lovers. Right off the bat, I know that the idea of any further interaction between users than you already have would start to seem goofy, but you also might want to appreciate how goofy your average playlist-maker, music geek, at-home DJ really is. We really love the fact that that Spotify can connect us with our people musically, especially in a time when people are doubting how genuine social media is...sharing the music we love with others always feels authentic. Currently, you can see a feed of your Facebook friends and what they're listening to in the Spotify app if you have linked the apps together. It is almost like a tease, in as much as you can see these people and what they're listening to yet you can't interact or weigh in at all. It's hard to think of a way to let users interact with each other without opening a huge can of worms, I can see that. I would like to recommend a few ideas that might work. 1) "Friend Recommendations"You could create a default playlist on everybody's account that was called "Friend Recommendations". You could create a function on every individual profile that allowed others to "recommend" music to other users in the same way the app allows us to add songs and albums to our own playlists, or in the way it allows us to see other users playlists and save them. This could keep people using the app longer because they're exploring and diving deep for the sake of sharing with friends and family. Imagine high schoolers and their crushes...this could be the new generation's burnt CD mix. Especially if they could do it in real time. Music is a language we ALL communicate with. 2) "Alerts" for Social InteractionCreating an in-app alert for Spotify is obviously a huge departure from the kind of app you are, I'm sure you don't want to be an intrusive overly-social app. However, in the same way many apps are launching "live sessions", or "group sessions" or "watch parties", you could have an option available for users to choose to be updated immediately when other users send them music in the app or not. You could have it become an option in the "queue" as it were, like, "your friend things you should put this on next". You could keep the queue open for your friends. It would be just like how you can currently choose a private or public listening session. That's all I really have to say! I hope you can appreciate what I as a user would love to have, and I do think many people who use this app would find fun and connection in it. I think your app is already smooth enough to add anything else you want without harming the core function. I mean, you certainly have the talent, budget, and user base to get bigger and better!

title: [iOS] new home layout is an abomination
author: alverde3212
body: the new home layout objectively ruins the user experience. while the small handful of playlists that appear at the top of the screen are somewhat useful, the absence of "jump back in," recently played, genre/artist mixes etc suddenly renders spotify nearly useless. users relied on those features in order to find music with the highest degree of convenience, least degree of friction. now, scrolling through these giant full-screen thumbnails that-- UNBELIEVABLY AND EGREGIOUSLY-- play music that you have not requested be played is just really awful. what's the rhyme or reason here? you guys sell *convenience* to your users, not "interactivity." please please please integrate "view" options for users who would like the more streamlined UI. i don't want all this other junk and i will never use it the way you're hoping i will, which i can only assume is a clunky attempt at additional revenue generation.

title: [Subscription] Graduate and Doctoral Student Discount
author: emmakb
body: Currently, the student discount is set up to be available for 4 years per person. This is a hard and fast rule that does not include gradute or doctoral students. Moving forward, Spotify needs to rewrite their policy to be available for this large population of students! This way they can continue using a platform that they know and love while still getting the student discount that they so desperately need. Higher education is expensive, and being able to save money wherever possible is essential. These students deserve the same student discount as undergraduates. If you're a graduate student, doctoral student, or soon to be either one, hit the like button to make this dream a reality! 100 votes and it'll get passed on for review!

title: [Subscription] Teacher Discount
author: celticmelody1
body: It would be great if Spotify offered a teacher discount for Spotify Premium. Increasingly I am using Spotify in my classroom, but it is frustrating to have to constantly monitor it and jolt across the classroom to mute the ads. I am happy to support the artists I listen to by paying for Spotify Premium, except that with ever more budget constraints, especially to arts programs, it is not feasible to shell out $120/yr from the school's or my own personal budget. I believe that if a teacher discount was offered, we would also be able to promote the use of Spotify with our own students thereby increasing Spotify's users.

title: [Other] Spotify Mini (iPod Nano/Shuffle for Spotify)
author: Penutbuttrr
body: The generations that use Spotify the most right now are the ones that have extreme nostalgia for the iPod nano and all of the portable music devices. I guarantee you that people would have brought them back if it wasn't for two things.1. BluetoothBluetooth was one of the biggest changes to music. Not having the ability to use your airpods or new Bluetooth headphones with an iPod nano is such a detriment. No one wants to go back to using chorded headphones, they want the ease of Bluetooth.2. The change in purchasing music:No one buys music anymore, and that's because of you. Music streaming is how almost everyone listens to music now. Not being able to access your music streaming on an iPod nano is THE reason as to why it has no been brought back like records have. But I present to you the Spotify Mini. With the incredible development of technology within the past decade. Making a device the size of the iPod nano/shufle has so much potential. I propose that you create a device akin to the iPod Shuffle/Nano but with 3 major improvements.1. Increased StorageThe amount of data that we can store in small spaces has skyrocketed since the iPod came out, and the amount that we can store within the small constraints of an iPod Nano is more than enough for all your music needs.2. Bluetooth compatibility.This is an obvious one. Let the device connect via spotify and you're good to go.3. SPOTIFYNow yeah this is obvious, but this device uses Spotify! It will connect to your account through whatever device you choose that you are logged in on, and it has full access to all your playlists and liked songs as long as you have access to wifi. You can download playlists just like you can on your phone, and you can play them whenever, wherever, with such a tiny device. Now finally, why do this at all?Like I said before, the generation that is using Spotify the most are ones that used the iPod nano and shuffle during their childhood. And with this huge nostalgia boost that has been happening recently, recreating this revolutionary device for modern trends and applications would be HUGE. Besides the nostalgia though, the device alone is incredibly useful. For exercising, people will no longer need to take their phone just for music, they can take this small device that can clip to their pants or rest in their pocket with barely any weight and have access to any podcast or playlist they desire without the inconvenience of their oversized phone. I know I got a bit passionate about this, and I'm honestly not sure if anyone will end up reading this. But hopes to one day this reaches someone who can make something really cool. Thank you for reading!

title: [Desktop][Podcasts] Custom Playback Speed
author: Dementia
body: Greetings Spotify Peoples 🙂, I think it would be cool to be able to customize your playback speed with the same sort of granularity that YouTube offers (see attached screenshot) when watching videos on the Spotify service. YouTube offers a slider that will increase/decrease the step by 0.05x. When watching videos, I prefer to watch them at a speed of 1.35x, thus the reason for my request. At present, Spotify - speaking of speeds between 1.00x and 2.00x - only has 1.2, 1.5, and 1.8 speed to select from. For this request I am referring to the Windows App predominantly, but it would be cool if it were available on other platforms also. Many Thanks,David 🤘

title: [Other] trim/shorten/cut/limit length of songs. automatically play next song after adjustable time
author: bernd_
body: Depending on the situation (e.g. listening to songs in the background) some songs tend to get boring or even annoying after playing too long. Often lyrics and melodies are just repeating over and over and a song that makes joy for the first maybe 2:30 minutes, gets too long while going on until the end after 4, 5 or more minutes. It would be great to have an option to limit the length of songs. After this time, just the next song in the queue shall be played.(in future maybe even with an algorithm choosing automatically a passage within the song to end it).The only similar topic I could find here in the community is:https://community.spotify.com/t5/Live-Ideas/Music-Custom-Start-amp-Ending-Times-for-a-Track/idi-p/40... But what I'm asking for is much simpler. Not individually for each song, but just a general setting to toggle on/off to cut songs down to e.g. 2 minutes. I know from an arts point of few it's not okay to destroy a song this way. But I think many more different songs could make it into some playlists, where they are not selected at the moment due to their length. For example, when trying to make one playlist for people with diverse tastes to listen to together. I would be super happy and enjoy Spotify even more. Thanks for your feedback on this.

title: Listen Later section
author: kaylahinds
body: If a "Listen Later" option was implemented into Spotify, I think it would help people keep their music libraries much cleaner. Personally, I save a lot of artist's discography's that I want to listen to but it can take me a while to get to it, therefore my library is a massive jumble of albums I listen to regularly and albums I want to listen to eventually. title: Playlist browser
author: PartyPancakes
body: I think it would be cool if there was a way to browse all existing user-created playlists on Spotify.Would be nice to sort based on follow count, maybe filter by most prominent genre.But the main idea is that this, in my opinion, would be a new way to find new music.I often find myself bored of listening to the same playlists I have over and over again and I have tried multiple times to find third party apps and websites that act as aggregators for Spotify playlists, but I couldn't really find a suitable option and I think if we could browse for new playlists to listen to directly in the app, that would be pretty neat.
status_message: Updated on 2023-03-29Hi there @PartyPancakes,   Thanks for the Idea submission.   You can already search for such playlists. Simply enter a keyword that you'd like to start from in the search field and then click the "Playlists" button from the filtering options. You should receive a collection of playlists ordered based on popularity.   Hope this helps.

title: [Other] Car thing preset buttons need some refinements
author: imark123440542
body: the way the top preset buttons work is a little unintuitive and easily miss programmed. I would love to see it work in a way much like a car radio, where you either select the album or song or playlist and then press and hold for approximately 3 to 5 seconds to set and then have some sort of Visual confirmation. I have on 3 or 4 occasions had to reprogram them as they have gotten bumped somehow or reset. And then I had to re-figure out how to program back to what they were, which only happens if you go to the playlist you want and play a song within that. Which requires you to stop playing what is currently playing and play something else before it can be reset.
status_message: Updated on 2023-03-28Hey @imark123440542,   Thanks for bringing your feedback to the Idea Exchange.   The goal of Spotify’s Car Thing exploration was to better understand in-car listening, and bring audio to a wider range of users and vehicles. Based on several factors, including product demand and supply chain issues, we have decided to stop further production of Car Thing units. Existing devices will perform as intended. We’ve learned a lot from Car Thing, and will continue to focus on the car as an important place for audio.   With this in mind, we'll be closing all Car Thing-related ideas, however, we do appreciate your feedback and we've made sure to forward it to the relevant team.   Thanks for understanding.

title: Podcast file management
author: user-removed
body: Please allow for greater control and file management for podcasts - if you want to be taken seriously as a podcast platform. See for example Pocketcast's feature set. Some features I think that would greatly improve the experience:create podcast groups/folders. create podcast specific playlists i.e. podcast playlists that appear in the 'Podcasts & Shows' tab of Your Library.ability to archive (and hide played episodescustomisable Your Library tabs. If you listen to more than a dozen or so different shows regularly, podcast episode management quickly becomes a cluttered and messy experience inside of Spotify.I love Spotify, though as someone who listens to a lot of podcasts, I have found the Spotify podcast experience, as it is currently designed, to be a somewhat limited experience.
status_message: Updated on 2023-03-28  Hey @user-removed,   Thanks for bringing your feedback to the Idea Exchange.     We’re closing this idea since it doesn’t meet one of our Idea Exchange guidelines, namely “One change request per Idea.”   We appreciate your elaborate idea, however, when one post includes several feature requests, it becomes hard to keep track of and update them. In addition, similar ideas have already been suggested here and here. Make sure you leave your vote to support them, so that they would have a better chance of being considered, as Spotify always strives to improve your experience.   Lastly, it's already possible to auto delete played podcasts on our Mobile App. The frequency of removal of episodes can be adjusted from the cogwheel icon in "Your episodes".  If you'd like to remove played episodes - go to this setting and adjust the frequency as you prefer it.   Cheers!

title: Add to Beginning of Queue vs End of Queue
author: ainsleywilson
body: Instead of just one feature, "add to queue," make two options: "add to beginning of queue" and "add to end of queue." Sometimes you're in the car with a group of friends, and you're trying to curate the exact right songs to play. Then you come across a song that fits perfect and you need to play it immediately but you first have to add it to the queue and then drag it all the way up. Instead, having two features to add to queue would make it a lot simpler to curate the perfect queue without completely messing with it. Oftentimes when I drag up songs, the app glitches and kicks me out anyway, so this solution would bypass that. Just think about it.

title: [Desktop][Other] better embed support for discord and external websites
author: AlexSquibbs
body: in discord, when a user sends a spotify link, an embed for that link will appear in the desktop app in which users can interact with and listen to music with. problem with this is that these embeds treat all users as if they are guests, and that leaves users only getting preview audio rather than the full spotify embed experience. as i have seen with the spotify embeds on my website, users who have not logged into spotify on that browser will get preview audio, while users who have logged into spotify on that browser will get the full audio experience. even if you link your spotify and discord accounts, you will still get treated as a guest user and will get the preview audio, while people who have linked their spotify and discord accounts seem to have the opportunity to be able to play the full audio from the embed. my second part of this is that i suggest the feature to show that embeds are currently playing in the spotify app (desktop/mobile/web/etc), so that users know where the audio source is coming from and can control it. i suggest maybe making the audio source either like the domain name of the website, or whatever is in the websites <title> html tag. for now, spotify just pauses in the player and plays whatever is in the embed without really letting the user know in the app that it is in fact playing from another source (the embed). another part of this that links with the first part, is that the same thing should occur for discord embeds, but this time just mark the audio source as like "Discord". lastly, maybe speak with discord about having their desktop app check if spotify is installed (or running if you want to do that instead), and if so, redirect directly from discord to the spotify app rather than opening a browser page. back on 2/13/2022, i made a discovery that linkages from spotify from the discord desktop app will directly go to the spotify mobile app if the user has the spotify android app installed via windows subsystem, rather than going to a browser page to display. its really cool that this already happens with the spotify android app via windows subsystem for android, but it would be even cooler if this were to happen with the native windows spotify desktop app as well since most people arent gonna have spotify for android installed on their computer sorry that this is a ton to digest, but i just felt like i wanted to share this because i think it would make spotify feel more user friendly and just more "smooth" and "connected" if you know what i mean 😉

title: Limit songs that appear on curated playlists & encourage new artists on curated playlists
author: SlugWheeler
body: I love the concept that Spotify curates playlists for me based on music I’ve liked or played. Currently, however, Spotify’s curated playlists are NOT doing what I most want from third party input: I want a fresh, new, different perspective on music so that I can discover new songs and, especially, new artists. Currently, Spotify’s curated playlists annoy me because they just regurgitate the same songs I’ve already listened to and, for that very reason, those songs are no longer interesting or enjoyable to me. With that said, I have two suggestions for Spotify:1) Have a way for Spotify users to select the “type” of curated playlists that they want to receive, with options such as: “new artists only,” “new music only,” “a mix of only new artists and new music,” “a mix of 75% new artists/music and 25% ‘loved’ music,” “a 50-50 mix of new artists/music and ‘loved’ music,” or “only a mix of ‘loved’ music and artists I’m following.”Another feature that Spotify could add that would somewhat address my concern stated above is to…2) Add a feature that would allow Spotify users to limit how often songs appear on their curated playlists. For example, users could set preferences that would limit songs from appearing on their curated playlists to no more than X number of times during an X week/month/year period. So if I had this ability, again for example, I would set my preferences to limit any song from appearing on my curated playlists to no more than once during a one week period AND no more than 3 times within a 5 week period. This suggestion gets at my being tired of hearing the same music over and over, which would be nice. But this suggestion does not address my desire to learn about new artists and new songs, which I value.
status_message: Updated on 2023-03-28 Hey @SlugWheeler,   Thanks for bringing your feedback to the Idea Exchange.     We’re closing this idea since it doesn’t meet one of our Idea Exchange guidelines, namely “One change request per Idea.”   We appreciate your elaborate idea, however, when one post includes several feature requests, it becomes hard to keep track of and update them.   If you have more than one idea, you can make a new idea submission for each one. title: [Other] Sleep mode - end of album
author: InstrumentalHopper
body: Sleep mode is my favourite feature in Spotify lately, and have been enjoying using it. Sometimes I turn it on when I'm listening to a playlist and select the audio to stop within the timer I select. However, when I listen to an album, I can only choose to use sleep mode with a timer or when the song has ended. I would like to have the option to use the sleep mode while listening to an album and when the album has ended, the audio stops. This way the listening experience is perfect in my opinion. There doesn't have to be an abrupt ending in the song when the timer has lapsed, it just stops when the album is finished. I can just leave my device on the other side of the room, while I'm in bed enjoying the music. Also, this can be applicable for playlists: when the audio stops, the playlist has ended. Maybe this won't be used as much, but the users have extra freedom using Spotify with it. Of course I am happy to use a bèta version of Spotify with this feature and share my feedback. Also, if you are interested in this feature too, let Spotify know. The community is the best place to make our listening experience better.

title: [Android][Developer] Work music is skewing Spotify suggestions
author: mitchk10
body: I listen to Spotify all day while I work: sounds of rain, lofi beats, instrumentals, etc. Essentially - white noise. This results in every single suggestion from Spotify - including the newly released AI DJ - being in this "atmospheric" genre that I don't want to listen to on my free time. The "free time" music is when I want Spotify's suggestions the most: to discover new music I like. Spotify needs to learn how to ignore music trends from M-F 9-5 and focus on what I like to listen to during the weekend. Or - the AI should base its suggestions on the time of day and day of week.
status_message: Updated on 2023-03-27Hi there @mitchk10, Thanks for the Idea Submission.   You can now remove unwanted items from your taste profile, so you don't get recommendations for certain types of music. Check out this article for more info.   Cheers.

title: [Android][Developer] Spotify adapted for people with intellectual disabilities
author: juliribotta
body: Hello! I'm Julieta Ribotta, I'm an argentinian student of biomedial engineering.Last week we were with some of my classmates in an institut por people with different capacities and we came across with this problem. This people, are in love of music, it brings them joy, clam and amusement. Currently they have a radio program and different kind of activities. They told us that listening to music is one of the things they enkoy the most, but the problem is that most of the applications for doing this are so developped that sometimes it turns out to be more difficult. After this, we came up with the idea of making an app that would suit more to their needs. We'are going to try to developed this but then i also thougth that maybe you could be interesting in participating, or help us in any kind of way. Just a thought! This simple changes can really change the way this people are included to the society, we don't always think on their needs but it's fundamental to become a more equalitary society.Thank you for your time!Greetings,Julieta. mail:**bleep**
status_message: Updated on 2023-03-27Hey @juliribotta ,   Thanks for the submission.    As much as we'd like to help you out directly in this regard, the forum is not the right place for such a request. We'll close this submission now, but we encourage you to contact our Press department through the contact form on this page: https://newsroom.spotify.com/press-inquiries/   Hope this helps,   Cheers!

title: [iOS][Your Library] Test Drive or Just Visiting
author: s7eevi2
body: Add a button or feature option to enable when playing an Artist, genre or song that you don’t want to be saved or fingerprinted to your profile. You may have a listening session test driving an Artist, genre or song, or at a party using your phone to play other peoples tunes or your phone is hijacked by the kids so that that Spotify doesn’t assume you like this style, band or song and don’t appear in recommendations etc. More importantly play counts don’t contribute to your Spotify unwrapped.
status_message: Updated on 2023-03-27Hey @s7eevi2,Thanks for bringing your feedback to the Idea Exchange. We’re closing this idea since it's already possible to do this. By excluding items from your Taste Profile, they will not affect future recommendations the algorithm chooses for you. Also, activating a Private Session achieves the effect of listening to something without it being considered for recomendations.   Hope this clears things up.

title: [Android][Playlists] Remember the queue of a playlist
author: Coalguy1
body: I have 2 playlists. One is my songs that I listen to on a daily basis, like driving to work or doing tasks. The other is my sleeping playlist that I have to fall asleep too. The problem is that I don't go through my whole daily basis playlist in a day, so when it comes time to go to bed I have to get rid of the queue of my playlist. So when I wake up and shuffle the playlist again, I have a high chance of listening to the same songs again from the day before. I would like to be able to shuffle a whole playlist and not have to reshuffle everytime I listen to a different playlist or a podcasts. Adding the option to save a queue would be a good fix to have. A work around I had was to listen to the songs in order without shuffling them and just remembering the song I listened to last, but with the removal of the enhance feature I now can't add new songs in-between that change up the flow of the playlist. TL;DR: Add the ability to save a queue so I do not have to reshuffle a playlist and risk listening the same songs again and again.

title: Separate Profiles For Individual Users
author: FearlessKing
body: I use DnD for my own listening (indie, folk, rock, pop, etc.) but I also use it for background music when I host DnD games (atmospheric cinematic and video game music). It ends up splitting my usage about 50/50. This tends to give me a ridiculous wrapped and the AI DJ thinks I'm really into cinematic music for casual listening. Having different profiles is something that would benefit other styles of listening too. Exercise profile, driving profile, work profile, adult time profile, etc. I feel like wrapped and the AI DJ work best for people who listen to all their genres casually, but ultimately for people like us who curate different areas of life with different music it leads to a jumbled mess for finding new music suggestions. I'm sure this is not an easy thing to implement but doing so would be extremely useful for a lot of us.

title: [All Platforms][Other] Add an alternative german translation without "gender star"
author: Sacer
body: Even though this idea: https://community.spotify.com/t5/Closed-Ideas/Please-let-me-disable-the-stupid-Genderstern/idi-p/546... got closed with a reference to another closed issue here: https://community.spotify.com/t5/Closed-Ideas/All-Platforms-Other-Please-make-genderstar-in-german-l... I just want to open it again. The approach of ideologized language does not fit the valid rules of the german language and therefore it disturbs the whole experience with your service if language settings are set to "German". Please understand that noone want's to cancel that custom version of the german language a minority of people share and use (it's actually only 10% of the population). We just want to have the native german language added back as an option. This wouldn't be so hard as you only have to remove everyting like "*innen". I'd volunteer for the job of i18n that, if it's a matter of staff costs. Just don't ignore over SEVENHUNDRED upvotes for that idea! Please consider that idea. It's not hard to implement and would make the experience of Spotify better for the majority of your german customers. Thanks! inb4: I'll open that idea again, and again, and again. So please at least TRY to dialogue with us.

title: [iOS][Other] Equalizer on Apple Watch
author: Sclievre
body: When I listen to music, I like to tune it to a very specific sound signature. Right now compared to the iPhone, my watch always sounds dull through my AirPods. Adding this feature would mean me listening more often on just my apple watch on runs and other situations.

title: [Mobile] Option to resize Lyrics font

title: [Desktop][Playlists] Add to playlist dialogue
author: Noguri
body: Hello.Spotify's desktop new interface is confusing for most of people. I have also new idea to create, which will be better.It'll be good to add 'add to playlist' dialogue instead of submenu in context menu. This dialogue will countains search box to find playlist by name and also, playlists will be as check boxes to select multiple playlist for adding a song. There will be also button 'add' to confirm our selection and add this track. It is very bad, that I must two or three times select 'add to playlist' option to add to two, or three playlist. title: Can we get a slider to change the volume for each ear individually?
author: henryr2005
body: I'm hearing impaired mostly in my left ear. This means that when I'm listening to music hear the right ear a lot clearer, as a music lover this leads to issues when songs pan parts to my left ear. I do have a hearing aid but headphones are never big enough to get the sound into the mic and I have to have them on at an angle. If the volume in my left ear was louder than in my right then I think it would make my whole experience a lot more enjoyable. What do you think?

body: My Uncle is blind and was looking forward to using the Spotify app on the Fire TV Stick that I got him for Christmas last year. title: Songs are being removed from my library?
author: ignis_fatuus
body: (defaulted to wrong forum; repost) I'm going to copy/paste user 2Madi's post form another thread (the query was inexplicably closed) because they sum up the issue pretty well and it's been driving me crazy for a year now: "On many occations i've noticed that some songs that I have on my playlist aren't there anymore. I have one main playlist with all the songs that I like and sometimes I add songs to the playlist to make sure that I have them there, expecting to see the notification pop up where it says that the song is already there and ask if I want to skip duplicates but it doesn't and I am 100% sure that i've had that song in the playlist before and listened to it in this playlist specifically.I have searched for the song in the playlist to see if I have it but from another album because that happens sometimes but a lot of times I don't have the song at all even though I am 100% certain that it's supposed to be there. I've noticed as well that my old playlist that I had years ago had over 2000 songs but now it only has 1000. Can it have something to do with spotify changing the directories of the songs like if the song is in an album they remove the single and if I have the single in my playlist it gets removed? Or if an artist release a deluxe version of an album and spotify removes the regular album because it doesn't need to be there anymore when the deluxe album is there and better, and if I have songs on my playlist from that album they will be removed from my playlist? That's my theory but I don't know, all I know is it's very annoying.Does anyone know the reason or if there is any way to solve it?Thanks!" For example, Stones Throw Records has a playlist called "Junie". I saved Susie Thundertussy from there months ago. Go to check today because I hadn't heard the song in awhile and I was able to re-add it from that particular playlist when it should have already been in my library. What is going on?

title: Track Recording Date
author: david100
body: Please add the date a track was recorded, preferably by adding a column or, alternatively, by adding a "properties" or similar category to track right-click options. Jazz and classical enthusiasts would find this particularly interesting and helpful, because a particular artist may have recorded different performances of the same piece at different stages of his/her career, and the information used to be available on vinyl LP covers. I'm not interested in CD/track issue dates of previously recorded material as the dates are irrelevant to the original recording date. It's possible that jazz and classical enthusiasts, particular those of us old enough to have grown up with vinyl, are only a small proportion of Spotify's customers - but I hope there are enough of us to get this idea accepted.

title: Only a handful of songs are played from playlist
author: stoked10
body: So it looks like this problem is posted all over the internet, but I can't find a solution for it. I have a 167 song playlist that I like to play, but at random times when playing it, it will only play the same 10 songs in a row, shuffle or no shuffle, over and over again, like it doesn't even see the other 157 songs. I even tried to select one of the songs it doesn't play and add it to "up next" and I get an error saying I can't do that while connected to this device (on bluetooth). How do I make shuffling (or even just playing a playlist) see all of my playlist songs? There are songs on my playlist I've never even heard because of this. And I will say that it really seems to pick the last 10 or so songs I added to the playlist as the songs to continually repeat

title: Yoga/Meditation Playlist
author: Queenkiri
body: Hi,I love the great selection and variety of playlists available, but I am always seeking new relaxing and inspiring instrumental tracks for my meditation and yoga practice. I would love if spotify made a few meditation/yoga playlists, possibly one featuring Native American flutes and tracks by Carlos Nakai, Marina Raye, and other emotive artitsts. Thanks!
